result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarvis Allen Hoskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Credit for 33 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarvis Allen Hoskins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarvis Allen Hoskins in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached an agreement. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Parties prepared to proceed to sentencing. Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 33 days in the House of Correction, with 33 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges by 1-10-2018, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
